messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] eating raw foods
messages.msgSnippet: You might be interested in looking into the American Natural Hygiene Society. They are an organization of people who eat mostly raw foods and avoid the cooking
messages.messageBody:
You might be interested in looking into the American Natural Hygiene
Society. They are an organization of people who eat mostly raw foods and
avoid the cooking process if at all possible. They have a magazine that
comes out bimonthly with articles and recipes. The founder of this
organization was Herbert Shelton who was an outspoken Natural Hygienist and
who wrote many books on the subject of health and diet. I even have a few.

I tried looking for a website and it is anhs.org but it's not up yet.
Here is another website you could try that has some various information
about Natural Hygiene:
http://members.tripod.com/naturalnet/

Karin




> <<what does your trail mix have in it? Is there nothing cooked?>>
>
> It has various nuts and seeds, raw not roasted. The only thing close to
> being cooked are the raisins having been dehydrated.
>
> I am trying to avoid the processing and the cooking. I had heard of
people
> who only ate foods that could be eaten raw before, but then our local
paper
> did a big story and it really interested me. So I decided to try it and
> have loved the results so far....more energy, sleeping better, feeling
less
> puffy and stiff.
>
> Julie
>
